title: The Tearing
description: "New sprite in town" guardian Bob is having more than his fair share of problems when virus Megabyte threatens his new friends unless he completes a mysterious favour. Backed by his friends Bob refuses to comply but it's not long before the whole city is under threat from Megabyte's army leaving Bob with some tough decisions.

title: Racing the Clock
description: Enzo is doing his own delivery service at his sister's diner. Only he hasn't received any deliveries so far. Things seem hopeless for him until Megabyte's Vid Window comes up on line telling Enzo that he has a package that needs to be delivered to Hexadecimal, a multi-mask wearing virus who lives at the scarce location of Los Angles. Knowing Megabyte to be bad news in all, but Enzo couldn't resist in doing a single delivery order. He didn't tell Dot or Bob on who sent the package, but both Dot and Bob agree that it's too dangerous for a Sprite like Enzo to deliver a package in Los Angles, so Dot insists that Bob delivers it. The package in fact is a mask shape time bomb that will delete whoever is in possession of it. Hexadecimal is aware of this and puts the mask on Bob and sends him flying back to Mainframe. Enzo heard the news, then told Dot, and they now need to warn Bob about the mask he has right now. But a Game Cube is being inputted and Bob heads for the landing site for the Cube. Dot and Enzo followed him and made it inside the game which is a Racing Game. But will they manage to tell Bob to get away from the mask before time runs out?

title: The Quick & the Fed
description: Slow Food doesn't come fast like Fast Food.

title: Medusa Bug
description: When Hexadecimal tricks Megabyte into releasing the Medusa, an unstoppable viral bug, on Mainframe, it's up to Bob to save the day.

title: The TIFF
description: Bob and Dot brake up.

title: In the Belly of the Beast
description: Unformat Command isn't edible.

title: The Crimson Binome
description: Mainframe is raided by Captain Capacitor and his crew of software pirates. When Bob is captured and thrown in the brig of the Saucy Mare, 'Admiral' Dot must give chase and save the day with some fancy (mostly verbal) fencing.

title: Enzo the Smart
description: Enzo's attempt to make himself twice as smart as everyone else only results in everyone else becoming twice as dumb as he is; and when a Game cube lands on them, it's up to Enzo to use the intelligence he does have to save the day.

title: Wizards, Warriors and a Word from Our Sponsor
description: Bob, Dot, Enzo and Mike the TV learn to work together when a group role-playing game lands on them.

title: The Great Brain Robbery
description: Megabyte's new plan to break into the Supercomputer by taking control of Bob's neural interface goes awry when Enzo unwittingly drinks Bob's spiked quantum shake.

title: Talent Night
description: Bob keeps Enzo busy on his birthday so Dot can audition talent acts to perform for the big event, but Megabyte has plans to crash the talent show.

title: Identity Crisis: Part 1
description: Dot loses faith in herself when an attempt to free a community of sprites from Megabyte's sector ends with their personal ID codes in Megabyte's control.

title: Identity Crisis: Part 2
description: After Cyrus betrays his fellow sprites by handing over their PIDs to Megabyte, Phong distorts Dot's reality to show her what Mainframe would be like if she were nullified.

title: Infected
description: Megabyte disguises himself as an upgrade to infiltrate the core of Mainframe.

title: High Code
description: A code master from the Net is searching Mainframe for a code master by the name of Tallon. It seems crotchety old Mr.Pearson might have some information to share.

title: When Games Collide
description: Megabyte's attempt to siphon energy from Mainframe causes two game cubes to overlap and trap him and Bob together to fight the User.

title: Bad Bob
description: Megabyte's continued attempts to steal Mainframe's energy lands Bob and Enzo in a corrupted Mad Max gamecube. With all of Mainframe's energy at risk for nullification, Bob must keep both the Users and the sprites from winning the game.

title: Painted Windows
description: Hexadecimal breaks into the Principal Office Archives and tampers with the paint program, using all of Mainframe as her canvas.

title: AndrAIa
description: With no other young sprites in Mainframe, Enzo is lonely. When an aquatic game drops on the diner, Enzo makes friends with a game sprite named AndrAla.

title: NullZilla
description: Something horrible comes through Hexadecimal's looking glass, mutating her into a black supervirus. The nulls launch an offensive on her, creating a gigantic null monster.

title: Gigabyte
description: The entity that came through the looking glass attacks and corrupts Megabyte, who then merges with Hexadecimal, transforming the two of them into Gigabyte, the next generation of virus.

title: Trust No One
description: Bob is on the case when a string of abductions claim Al's waiter and Dot. Special CGI agents Fax Modem and Data Nully arrive to investigate.

title: Web World Wars
description: Bob, Dot and Mouse must team up with Megabyte and Hexadecimal to save Mainframe from the attacking Web. Their attempt to close the portal to Mainframe ends with Bob being shot into the web.

title: To Mend and Defend
description: The group take refuge in the Principal Office, fending off Megabyte and Hexadecimal's onslaught on the city. A game cube inadvertently interrupts the attack. Enzo, unable to resist his Guardian protocol, enters the Evil Dead inspired game.

title: Between a Raccoon and a Hard Place
description: Phong convinces Dot that in order to give the citizens of Mainframe something to believe in, Enzo must face the User in a game alone as their Guardian.

title: Firewall
description: In his quest for dominance, Megabyte continues his propaganda campaign against Enzo and those that remain in the Principal Office while the rest of Megaframe is defenseless against the destruction.

title: Game Over
description: Megabyte uses Hexadecimal's viral energy to penetrate the firewall. Enzo, AndrAla and Frisket enter a game they cannot win.

title: Icons
description: Matrix and AndrAla ride a game into a ravaged system, recruiting a group of brave sprites to train in game play.

title: Where No Sprite Has Gone Before
description: AndrAla and Matrix find their way into a system run by a group of Superguardians who were once spectrals whose leader bears a striking resemblance to Bob.

title: Number 7
description: Matrix is ready to give up his search for Mainframe when it seems he's found it in the form of a game. When AndrAla and Matrix reboot, they take the form of Megabyte and Hexadecimal. The goal of the game: find number one.

title: The Episode with No Name
description: Matrix and AndrAla finally land in a system that has ports to the Net, Matrix meets Guardian Turbo, who explains that a dangerous virus named Daemon has infected all Guardians save for Bob and Matrix.

title: Return of the Crimson Binome
description: Of all the bars in all the Web, Captain Capacitor walks into the one Matrix and AndrAla are hiding out in. With the help of Web surfer Ray Tracer, they set sail for the Edge of Beyond.

title: The Edge of Beyond
description: While The Saucy Mare sails through the Edge of Beyond, AndrAla is bitten by a Web creature that steals her energy. Matrix must learn to trust Ray to save her.

title: Web Riders on the Storm
description: While hunting for the Web creature that bit AndrAla, The Saucy Mare engages in a full-blown battle with a swarm of the monsters. Just when it looks as though all hope is lost for the crew, a new protector arrives.

title: Mousetrap
description: Having achieved their mission to find Bob, Matrix, AndrAla and the crew of The Saucy Mare set course for Mainframe.

title: Megaframe
description: Glitch Bob, Matrix, AndrAIa and the Software Pirates return from the Web to find Mainframe devastated by a war between Megabyte, Hexadecimal and the Mainframe resistance.

title: Showdown
description: The Mainframe resistance devises a plan to take back the Principal Office. Matrix alone faces Megabyte, who is trying to access the Web. Meanwhile, Glitch Bob gets tied up with Hexadecimal.

title: System Crash
description: In an attempt to save Mainframe from complete system shutdown, the sectors must be powered down. Glitch Bob enters the core to keep the Principal Office online. Tears begin opening all over the city, releasing saved Users from past games.

title: End Prog
description: The remaining inhabitants of Mainframe have survived Megabyte's bane, but the system is destroyed and dying. As their final hope they must cause a full system crash to spur the User to perform a restart.

title: Daemon Rising
description: Daemon, a Super Virus with a mind of a child.

title: Cross Nodes
description: Hexadecimal takes on a whole new form.

title: What's Love Got to Do with It?
description: Daemon learns about the meaning of love.

title: Sacrifice
description: The final conclusion of Daemon.

title: My Two Bobs
description: Glitch Bob and Regular Bob, which is real and which is a copy?

title: Life's a Glitch
description: The Seperation of Glitch and Glitch Bob.

title: Null-Bot of the Bride
description: It's a wedding and everyone is invited, well no quite everyone.

title: Crouching Binome, Hidden Virus
description: Megabyte is back, and more lethal than before.
